body_html:
Hmm, I guess the problem is that we don't test with -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF very often, and that option has bit-rotted... in particular, I don't think we've tested the Python support with it disabled.

I think the correct fix is to ensure that tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/server_lib.cc is compiled and linked in even when -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF. That will ensure that the unresolved symbol is defined in any case. Does that sound right? I'm preparing a fix now.
body_text:
Hmm, I guess the problem is that we don't test with -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF very often, and that option has bit-rotted... in particular, I don't think we've tested the Python support with it disabled.
I think the correct fix is to ensure that tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/server_lib.cc is compiled and linked in even when -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF. That will ensure that the unresolved symbol is defined in any case. Does that sound right? I'm preparing a fix now.
body:
Hmm, I guess the problem is that we don't test with `-Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF` very often, and that option has bit-rotted... in particular, I don't think we've tested the Python support with it disabled.

I think the correct fix is to ensure that `tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/server_lib.cc` is compiled and linked in even when `-Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GRPC_SUPPORT=OFF`. That will ensure that the unresolved symbol is defined in any case. Does that sound right? I'm preparing a fix now.
